lead_paragraph: Grappling with a mosquito-borne virus linked to brain damage in infants, El Salvador is advising all women in the country not to get pregnant until 2018.

byline.contributor: Gene Palumbo contributed reporting from San Salvador, and Donald G. McNeil Jr. from San Francisco.

snippet: Grappling with a mosquito-borne virus linked to brain damage in infants, El Salvador is advising all women in the country not to get pregnant until 2018.

headline.main: El Salvador’s Advice on Zika Virus: Don’t Have Babies
headline.print_headline: El Salvador’s Advice on Zika: Don’t Have Babies

abstract: El Salvador, beset by mosquito-borne Zika virus, advises all women in country to avoid becoming pregnant until 2018; warning is indication of government's desperation over epidemic, which has spread across Latin America and infected more than million people in Brazil.
